snippet: On Feb. 9, 1943, the United States declared victory against Japan in the seven-month World War II campaign for Guadalcanal and nearby islands in the southwest Pacific.
abstract: On Feb. 9, 1943, the United States declared victory against Japan in the seven-month World War II campaign for Guadalcanal and nearby islands in the southwest Pacific.
lead_paragraph: On Feb. 9, 1943, the United States declared victory against Japan in the seven-month World War II campaign for Guadalcanal and nearby islands in the southwest Pacific. The declaration came after American intelligence found that only small isolated groups of Japanese troops remained on Guadalcanal after a monthlong evacuation. The Feb. 10 edition of The New York Times quotes Secretary of the Navy Frank Knox, who announced that all resistance had "apparently ceased."

headline.main: Feb. 9, 1943 | U.S. Defeats Japan at Guadalcanal
